SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVE: Atrial fibrillation has been reported following esophageal photodynamic therapy
This study presents the results of serial cardiac testing following photodynamic therapy for patients with Barrett's esophagus and with dysplasia or early carcinoma
STUDY DESIGN/MATERIALS AND METHODS: Twelve patients were treated using photodynamic therapy
Serum creatinine phosphokinase and lactic dehydrogenase isoenzyme levels were determined pretreatment and 24, 48, and 72 hours after treatment
Electrocardiograms were obtained before and 48 hours after treatment
A rhythm strip was obtained 1 week posttreatment
Clinical assessment for cardiac arrhythmias occurred daily following therapy
RESULTS: Transient atrial fibrillation was noted in one patient during a follow-up endoscopy
However, no significant or permanent abnormality was noted in cardiac enzymes or electrocardiograms

CONCLUSION: No permanent electrocardiographic changes or significant abnormalities in cardiac enzymes were detected following esophageal photodynamic therapy in patients with or without histories of cardiac disease
Delivery of esophageal PDT is not associated with permanent adverse cardiac effects
